Description: Rim sherd of Chian black-figured Floral pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, streaky black below; part of lotus-palmette and rosette in added red and added white; exterior: band on top of rim; at rim, band of dots between two pairs of dilute bands; below, black-figure decoration consisting of lotus flower with red and part of lotus bud with red and white.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Floral decoration is not common on the outside of Chian chalices. For a parallel, see Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA80.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 332, no. 1616, pl. 208)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 82, nos. 23 and 30, pl. V)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1307) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
